severity_criteria.Critical: Confirmed C2 on a critical server (Domain Controller, Core App Server).
severity_criteria.High: Confirmed C2 on multiple workstations or a single high-value user workstation (e.g., Finance, HR).
severity_criteria.Medium: Confirmed C2 on a single standard user workstation.

containment_steps.action: Isolate the infected host(s) from the network using the EDR agent's network containment feature.
Block the malicious C2 IP address and domain at the edge firewall and web proxy.
If host cannot be isolated via EDR, contact the Network Team to shut down the switch port.
Reset the password for the user account associated with the infected host.
Search EDR, DNS, and proxy logs for the C2 indicators to identify other potentially infected hosts.

eradication_steps.action: Acquire a memory dump and disk image of the infected host for forensic analysis.
Re-image the infected host from a known-good corporate image. Do not attempt to 'clean' the malware.
Submit the malware hash and C2 indicators to relevant security tools (AV, EDR, threat intel platform).

recovery_steps.action: Monitor the re-imaged host for any signs of reinfection.
Restore user data from a clean backup if necessary.
Communicate with the user about the incident and provide security awareness reminders.

incident_response_playbooks.escalation_contacts: SOC Manager, IT Infrastructure Team, Threat Intelligence Team

severity_criteria.Critical: Any detection of ransomware activity, especially on file servers or multiple hosts.

containment_steps.action: IMMEDIATE: Isolate the file server and the source host(s) that initiated the encryption. Use network containment in EDR and/or shut down switch ports.
IMMEDIATE: Disable the user account(s) associated with the activity.
IMMEDIATE: Verify that backups are offline and isolated from the production network. Do not connect them.
Block any external C2 IPs associated with the ransomware strain if identified.

eradication_steps.action: Identify the ransomware strain by analyzing the ransom note and file extensions.
Forensically analyze the entry point to determine how the ransomware was deployed (e.g., phishing, RDP brute force).
Re-image all affected systems. Do not trust any system that was on the same VLAN as the outbreak.

recovery_steps.action: Once the network is confirmed clean, begin restoring data from the isolated, verified-clean backups.
Force a password reset for all users in the organization as a precaution.
Conduct a post-incident review to identify and remediate the security gaps that allowed the incident.

incident_response_playbooks.escalation_contacts: SOC Manager, Director of IT, Legal Department, Cyber Insurance Provider

severity_criteria.High: Evidence that a user's credentials were successfully submitted and the account was accessed by an attacker.
severity_criteria.Medium: User clicked a phishing link but no evidence of successful credential submission or login.

containment_steps.action: IMMEDIATE: Reset the password for the affected user account.
IMMEDIATE: Revoke all active sessions for the user (e.g., in Microsoft 365, VPN).
Block the phishing domain/URL at the web proxy and email gateway.
Use the email gateway to search for and delete the same phishing email from all other user inboxes.

eradication_steps.action: Analyze the compromised mailbox for attacker activity: new forwarding rules, sent items, deleted items.
Scan the user's workstation for any malware that may have been delivered alongside the phishing link.
Review logs for any systems the compromised account may have accessed after the breach.

recovery_steps.action: Once secure, re-enable the user account and provide the new password.
Ensure Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is enabled on the account.
Assign the user mandatory phishing awareness training.

severity_criteria.Critical: Large volume of data exfiltrated from a critical server or involving sensitive data (PII, Finance).
severity_criteria.High: Suspicious outbound connection using a known exfiltration technique (e.g., DNS Tunneling, ICMP Tunneling).

containment_steps.action: Isolate the source host from the network.
Block the external destination IP/domain at the firewall.
Analyze firewall and proxy logs to quantify the amount of data transferred.

eradication_steps.action: Forensically analyze the host to identify the malware or tool used for exfiltration.
Attempt to identify the type of data that was exfiltrated by analyzing host and file server logs.

recovery_steps.action: Implement firewall rules to block the exfiltration protocol used (e.g., deny outbound ICMP, restrict DNS queries).

incident_response_playbooks.escalation_contacts: SOC Manager, Legal Department, Data Protection Officer (DPO)

severity_criteria.High: Internal-to-Internal scanning from a non-IT host (potential lateral movement).
severity_criteria.Medium: Sustained external scanning against a critical service.

containment_steps.action: For external scans, block the source IP address at the firewall.
For internal scans, isolate the source host immediately as it is likely compromised.

eradication_steps.action: Review firewall and WAF logs to confirm no exploit attempts were successful.
If internal, begin the Malware Outbreak (PB-MAL-001) playbook on the source host.

recovery_steps.action: Monitor for further scanning activity from the same IP block or internal host.
